none: media/user/SCRAPE/test/2012-04-dropend/extracted/dropend/05 Bloody One Day, Friday Of Oblivion, 1959

Originally ripped by Terminal Escape, posted on April 09, 2012 Description from Terminal Escape:
Powerful and relentless chaotic Japanese hardcore - quality of the highest order with searing vocals struggling under an assault of guitar noise. Less than ten minutes of sound, but this one will reaffirm your commitment to living life with two fingers in the air. If you still give a fukk after listening to this, then it's time to hand in your studs and renew your civilian card. NEVERENDINGNOISE Hard copies still available from the always excellent Narm Discos and DROPEND can be found here.
//2.bp.blogspot.com/-smzbdHrlV_c/T4HXID7QjJI/AAAAAAAACk0/llNoAs_kYHA/s1600/Drop+End+front+copy.jpg //2.bp.blogspot.com/-cY6SSGdSvnU/T4HYP9QKU0I/AAAAAAAACk8/FXNUAg1wmY0/s1600/Drop+End+img+copy.jpg http://www.narmdiscos.com/ http://dropend.exblog.jp/
